Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: சொல்வணக்கம் ஒன்னார்கண் கொள்ளற்க வில்வணக்கந் தீங்கு குறித்தமை யான்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Since the bending of the bow bespeaks evil, one should not accept (as good) the humiliating speeches of one's foes.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A split image. On the right, an enemy warrior is drawing a bow. The bending of the bow ('வில்வணக்கம்') is an obvious sign of a coming, harmful attack ('தீங்கு குறித்தமை').
Layered_Composition.Midground: On the left, an enemy diplomat is bowing low and speaking with great humility and reverence ('சொல்வணக்கம்').
Layered_Composition.Background: The image makes a direct parallel: the humble speech of the enemy is just like the bending of the bow. It is not a sign of respect, but a preparation for an attack. A wise person is shown observing this, refusing to trust the humble words ('கொள்ளற்க').

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Do not trust the humble words of an enemy, for like the bending of a bow, they are merely a prelude to attack.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The direct visual comparison between the bowing diplomat and the bending bow is the central concept. It frames the diplomat's humility as a dangerous, martial act.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A tense, dramatic light. A sharp glint on the arrowhead of the bent bow is mirrored by a treacherous glint in the eye of the bowing diplomat.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A side-by-side composition that forces the viewer to see the equivalence of the two 'bendings'.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, with a focus on the tension in both scenes.
